feed.title: SAP Community - ABAP Development
feed.subtitle: ABAP Development Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Extend C_PurchaseReqnAcctAssgmt with custom fields in Fiori app Manage Purchase Requisitions (F2229)
entry.content:
Dear Community,

We want to extend Account Assignment table in Purchase Requisition Item with a few custom fields (columns) that are added using Append Structure in table EBKN. From our understanding, we need to extend the CDS view C_PurchaseReqnAcctAssgmt. 

This CDS view seems to have a chain of CDS selection before finally getting the data from table EBKN, i.e. C_PurchaseReqnAcctAssgmt -> T_PurchaseReqnAcctAssgmt -> I_PurchaseReqnAcctAssgmt -> I_PurReqnAcctAssgmt -> I_PurReqnAcctAssgmtBasic -> EBKN.

After checking some documentation, we found another CDS view E_Purreqnacctassgmt, which we thought could be used, but extending it doesn't help us in accessing those custom fields in C_PurchaseReqnAcctAssgmt or directly in the Fiori app.

Could someone suggest which CDS views we should extend to get these columns (custom fields) in the Fiori app, or is there a better way?

We tried checking first in Custom Fields and Logic app for a relevant Business Context for PR Account Assignment, but couldn't find anything appropriate. We still would like to keep our development as clean-core as possible.

entry.title: Mandatory fields required for BAPI_INB_DELIVERY_SAVEREPLICA to create an inbound delivery
entry.content:
Hi,

I‚Äôm reading data from an Excel file containing the following fields: Deliv_Type, Material, Dlv_Qty, Unit, Plant, Deliv_Date, Partner_No, Partn_Role, etc. My objective is to automatically create inbound delivery numbers in SAP based on this Excel data.

When I execute the BAPI, it runs without any errors, but no inbound delivery number is returned. I suspect that I might be missing some mandatory fields in one or more of the following structures:

  • HEADER_DATA
  • HEADER_PARTNER
  • ITEM_DATA
  • ITEM_ORG

Could someone please confirm which fields are mandatory in these structures? Also, is BAPI_INB_DELIVERY_SAVEREPLICA the correct BAPI to use for Excel-based inbound delivery creation, or should I use another one (for example, GN_DELIVERY_CREATE or BAPI_INB_DELIVERY_CREATE)?

Any working example or list of mandatory fields would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance

entry.title: getting 403 forbidden error in sap rap service url
entry.content:
Hi team,

i have created my first rap application in abap hana trail account setted up recently. its a simple read only application with two cds views, no biz logic. When i m clicking on service url its showing "403 Forbidden The request has been blocked by UCON. Server time: 2025-10-27 09:19:27" and metadata in rap application is also failing. Can you please let me know the root cause and solution.

BR,Shubh

entry.title: üöÄ ABAP: The Language That Powers Enterprises ‚Äî And Why It Still Matters in 2025
entry.content:
Every time a purchase order gets approved, a delivery is scheduled, or an invoice is posted in SAP‚ÄîABAP is quietly doing the heavy lifting.

It‚Äôs not flashy. It‚Äôs not hyped. But it‚Äôs mission-critical.

As an SAP Consultant, I‚Äôve seen ABAP solve real business problems‚Äîautomating approvals, generating invoices, building Fiori apps. And yet, I often hear this question:

‚ÄúIs ABAP still relevant in the age of AI and Cloud? Should I learn it in 2025?‚Äù

My answer? Absolutely. Here‚Äôs why.

üß† What is ABAP?

ABAP (Advanced Business Application Programming) is SAP‚Äôs language for building enterprise applications. It‚Äôs deeply tied to business processes‚ÄîMM for materials, SD for sales, FI for finance.

Think of ABAP as business logic in motion. It‚Äôs not just code; it‚Äôs how billion-dollar companies run.

üí° Real-World ABAP Use Cases

Here are a few examples I‚Äôve worked on:

‚úÖ Approval Workflows

 

  • Scenario: Multi-level PO approvals based on value.
  • Solution: SWDD workflows + custom ABAP classes + OData for Fiori.
  • Impact: Faster approvals, audit compliance, fewer errors.

 

üìÑ Smartforms for PDF Invoicing

 

  • Scenario: Finance wants branded invoices emailed automatically.
  • Solution: Smartforms ‚Üí PDF via CONVERT_OTF ‚Üí Email with CL_BCS.
  • Impact: Professional communication, reduced manual effort.

 

üìä ALV Reports for Inventory

 

  • Scenario: Warehouse needs real-time stock visibility.
  • Solution: ALV grids with filters, totals, Excel export.
  • Impact: Better planning, fewer stockouts.

 

üîß Enhancements for Custom Logic

 

  • Scenario: Auto-fill delivery dates in sales orders.
  • Solution: BADIs or user exits.
  • Impact: Time savings, consistency.

 

üì± OData Services for Mobile Approvals

 

  • Scenario: Managers want leave approvals on mobile.
  • Solution: OData via SEGW + Fiori app.
  • Impact: Mobile productivity, faster decisions.

 

üåê ABAP + Future Tech

ABAP isn‚Äôt stuck in the past. It‚Äôs evolving:

 

  • SAP BTP: ABAP now runs in the cloud with RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model).
  • AI Integration: Consume AI APIs for invoice classification, predictive analytics.
  • Cloud-Native: Build apps for S/4HANA Cloud and Steampunk.

 

üí° Imagine this: An ABAP workflow that calls an AI model to predict supplier risk and auto-routes high-risk POs to senior approvers. That‚Äôs ABAP + AI + Workflow.

üõ†Ô∏è Beginner‚Äôs Roadmap

Start with:

 

  • SE11: Data Dictionary.
  • SE38/SE80: Reports ‚Üí ALV.
  • Modularization: Function modules, includes.
  • Debugging: Breakpoints, ST05, SAT.
  • Enhancements: BADIs, user exits.
  • OData & CDS: For Fiori and BTP apps.

 

üí¨ Why ABAP is Strategic

ABAP developers don‚Äôt just code‚Äîthey build systems that run global businesses. You learn how enterprises think, how processes flow, and how tech drives decisions.

Final Thought: ABAP is evolving. With S/4HANA, BTP, and Fiori, it‚Äôs more relevant than ever. If you‚Äôre looking to start a career in SAP, ABAP is your launchpad.

Follow me for more deep dives into CDS views, workflow automation, and SAP BTP‚Äîwith real code, real use cases, and real impact.

entry.title: VA01 sales order creation, how to change VBAK-VDATU manually and logically based on SHIP-TO
entry.content:
Hi Abapers,

i am working in Sales order creation enhancement such that in VA01 i need below custom functionality for field requested delivery date : VBAK-VDATU

1. Initially when we create sales order,  there is logic that determines VDATU based on ship-to party. its working fine.

2. If user change ship-to in VA01, again VDATU should change as per new Ship-to, it is also working fine.

3. Now if user wants to change date manually not using logic, that same date should be updated : THIS IS NOT WORKING

I am unable to identify in the User exit that this is manual update by the user. So, every time the value gets changed as per logic.

i am using MV45AFZZ : USEREXIT_MOVE_FIELD_TO_VBAK 

Cannot use USEREXIT_SAVE_DOCUMENT_PREPARE

entry.title: Sales order creation enhancement VA01 : Issue in Manual and logical update of VBAK-VDATU
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

I am working in Sales order creation enhancement such that in VA01 i need below custom functionality for field requested delivery date : VBAK-VDATU

  1. Initially when we create sales order,  there is logic that determines VDATU based on ship-to party. its working fine.
  2. If user change ship-to in VA01, again VDATU should change as per new Ship-to, it is also working fine.
  3. Now if user wants to change date manually not using logic, that same date should be updated : THIS IS NOT WORKING

I am unable to identify in the User exit that this is manual update by the user. So, every time the value gets changed as per logic.

i am using MV45AFZZ : USEREXIT_MOVE_FIELD_TO_VBAK 

Cannot use USEREXIT_SAVE_DOCUMENT_PREPARE

Since the exit USEREXIT_MOVE_FIELD_TO_VBAK gets called multiple times so we are facing issues in achieving both manual and logical updates.

entry.title: Displaying Serial numbers in custom cds views Report
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I‚Äôm currently working on a custom CDS view/report in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and would like to display serial numbers (for materials) in the output. Could anyone please guide me on the best approach to achieve this? Specifically, I‚Äôm looking for:

  1. How to include serial numbers in custom CDS views (built in Eclipse ADT).
  2. Whether it‚Äôs possible to fetch and display them directly through released data sources or associations.
  3. Any alternative methods (e.g., using standard I_* views, extensibility options, or Fiori analytical queries) to display serial numbers in reports.

entry.title: Obtain ATP in bulk (internal table)
entry.content:
Hi guys

I want to avoid a function within a LOOP (optimize performance). This function 'BAPI_MATERIAL_AVAILABILITY' is to obtain the ATP but of value in value. I need to take it out of the loop and pass only the call to a local method that gets me the ATP massively (by internal table).

After trying a thousand things, and losing several hours I think my best solution is the class ‚ÄòCL_ATP_CONTROLLER‚Äô with his method ‚ÄòCHECK_AVAILABILITY‚Äô. Bellow you can see the code used but always the answer is (et_atp_results = lt_atp_results) lt_atp_results-available_qty =0.  And does not get me ATP  (verified with CO09).

Can you give me your opinion or alternatives?

Thank you very much Xavi

ABAP CODE:

DATA: lt_scheduleline_success TYPE tbl_atpcs_s4,
lt_pred_ref TYPE tbl_atp_ref,
lt_delta TYPE tbl_atp_delta_pac,
lt_sched_result TYPE tbl_atp_scheduling_result,
lt_atp_results TYPE tbl_atp_results,
lo_atp_ctrl TYPE REF TO cl_atp_controller.

CREATE OBJECT lo_atp_ctrl.

lo_atp_ctrl->initialize( ).

APPEND VALUE #(
matnr = ‚Äò9134725‚Äô
werks = ‚Äò001‚Äô
sobkz = ‚Äô ‚Äô " Stock especial: B = Pedido de ventas
sskey = ‚Äô ‚Äô
sskey_ext = ‚Äô ‚Äô
lgort = ‚Äô ‚Äô
charg = ‚Äò0000000001‚Äô
berid = ‚Äò001‚Äô
base_uom = ‚ÄòUN‚Äô " Unitat de mesura
reqdate = sy-datum " Data de la necessitat
reqqty = 9999999999 " IMPORTANT: Quantitat sol¬∑licitada
mtvfp = ‚ÄòZ2‚Äô
prreg = ‚ÄòA‚Äô " Regla de verificaci√≥
trtyp = ‚ÄòA‚Äô " Tipus de transacci√≥: A = Consulta
resmd = ‚Äô ‚Äô " Gesti√≥ de recursos
enmng = 9999999999 " Quantitat en unitat base
pac_relevant = ‚ÄòX‚Äô " Rellevant per a PAC
pal_relevant = ‚Äô ‚Äô " No rellevant per a PAL
arun_relevant = ‚Äô ‚Äô " No rellevant per a ARUN
) TO lt_scheduleline_success.

CHECK lt_scheduleline_success IS NOT INITIAL.

TRY.
lo_atp_ctrl->check_availability(
EXPORTING
it_scheduleline = lt_scheduleline_success
it_pred_ref = lt_pred_ref
it_delta_correction = lt_delta
it_delta_dbstate = lt_delta "Afegim aquest par√†metre tamb√©
it_sched_result = lt_sched_result
IMPORTING
et_atp_results = lt_atp_results
et_sched_result = DATA(lt_sched_result_success)
et_exception = DATA(lt_exception_cur_iteration)
et_message = DATA(lt_message)
et_results_decision = DATA(lt_results_decision_success) ).

CATCH cx_root INTO DATA(lx_error).
WRITE: / ‚ÄòError capturat:‚Äô, lx_error->get_text( ).
ENDTRY.

" Verifiquem els missatges d‚Äôerrors
IF lt_message IS NOT INITIAL.
" Processa els missatges d‚Äôerror aqu√≠
LOOP AT lt_message INTO DATA(ls_message).
WRITE: / ls_message-msgty, ls_message-msgid, ls_message-msgno, ls_message-msgv1.
ENDLOOP.
ENDIF.

" Verifiquem els resultats
LOOP AT lt_atp_results INTO DATA(ls_atp_result).
WRITE: / ‚ÄòQuantitat disponible:‚Äô, ls_atp_result-available_qty,
/ ‚ÄòData confirmaci√≥:‚Äô, ls_atp_result-cnfdate.
ENDLOOP.

entry.title: smartforms text element - office interface crashes
entry.content:
Today I had to edit a Smart Forms. I opened a "text element." Word opened. I entered what I needed to do and closed the editor. Then the entire screen froze, and I couldn't do anything. Until yesterday, it worked perfectly. The only thing different is that yesterday my computer underwent Office updates.

I work on S4/HANA. I have SAP GUI 8.0 patch 5. I haven't had any problems for 18 months. From today, my screen froze. Could it have been the Office update that caused the problem? Thanks

entry.title: Add 'Net Due Interval 4' field in the 'Aging Grid of journal entry view of Account Receivables'
entry.content:
Hi Team,

Standard Fiori Application - Aging Grid of journal entry view of Account Receivables, have total 3 filters/parameters as 'Net Due Interval 1', 'Net Due Interval 2' and 'Net Due Interval 3'  which have default values as 30, 60 and 90 respectively.

Is it possible to add a new filter as a 'Net Due Interval 4' which will be having default value as 120 (editable)? (as shown in below screenshot)

My Observation - What I observed is, the existing fields 'Net Due Interval 1, 2 and 3 are coming from the underlying Interface CDS view - P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid1 . And by taking reference of 'Net Due Interval 1, 2 and 3', if we add the new field 'Net Due Interval 4' in this interface view by extending it then we have to add this field in all the other Interface Views and final consumption view also. Below are those standard cds views which needs to be extended to accommodate the new field 'Net Due Interval 4' - 

1) P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid1 --> 1st Interface view to be extended 
2) P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid2 
3) P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid3 --> Here need to update the existing logic to calculate 'NetDueInterval' field with respect to 'Net Due Interval 4'
4) P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid4 --> Need to update the logic for fields 'Net Due Interval Amount 1, 2, 3 & 4' because 'NetDueInterval' (which is calculated in above cds view) is used in the calculation of those amount fields.
5) I_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid --> This is Cube View
6) C_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid --> This is Final Consumption view or Analytics Query View

Also I have observed that, the existing AR Aging report is giving correct result when I enter value 120 days in the 'Net Due Interval 3' for my requirement to calculate for 120 days interval.

Now, please guide -->

1) Is it possible to add 'Net Due Interval 4' field in the standard AR Aging Report?

2) If YES, then please validate my above observation i.e. we have to extend total 6 standard CDS views to add this new field.

3) In views 'P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid3' and 'P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid4' --> we have to update existing logic to calculate 'NetDueInterval' and 'Net Due Interval Amount 1, 2, 3 & 4' respectively. Is this is correct i.e. to update existing fields logic while doing CDS Extend?

4) If No, then shall we proceed by entering 120 days in 'Net Due Interval 3' which is giving us the correct the result?

Note - My system is S4HANA on Premise >> Release 2021 .

Thanks in advance.
